MaleStrings.String: I won't fail you.
We'll destroy them all.

Vanguards are feared for their high-risk, high-reward combat style, closing quickly on enemies and destroying them at short range with weapons and biotic abilities. They are outfitted with L5n implants, enabling them to perform a biotic charge that strikes the opponent with incredible force while bringing the Vanguard in for close-range combat.
Vanguard Powers: Incendiary Ammo Cryo Ammo Biotic Charge Nova Shockwave Pull

Infiltrators are tech and combat specialists with the unique ability to cloak themselves from visual and technological detection. Their inventory is stacked with a wide variety of weapons, equipment, and powers. Infiltrators are deadly at any range, but particularly so with a sniper rifle. When scoping a target, superior reflexes take over, time momentarily slows down, and the Infiltrator finds an easy picking.
Infiltrator Powers: Disruptor Ammo Cryo Ammo Incinerate Tactical Cloak Sticky Grenade Sabotage

Sentinels are unique, bringing both tech and biotic abilities to the battlefield. In addition to complete weapons training, Sentinels are equipped with an advanced shield that makes taking cover much less necessary and rushing their enemies much more productive. This armor system can also be detonated to blast nearby enemies.
Sentinel Powers: Throw Warp Lift Grenade Tech Armor Overload Cryo Blast
Sniper Damage Bonus
Flight Recorder
Shuttle Wreckage
M-920 Cain
Destroy Hades Cannon
Locate another M-90 Cain
Destroy Reaper defense gun
Evac Shuttle
Admiral Anderson

Clear out Reaper Strongpoint

Jethra,
I looked over this year's candidates for supervised visits to Thessia. I'm approving everyone but Yanis. She's impulsive, cunning, and worst of all, a romantic. Find me a worse combination to let outside our walls. (I find it suspicious she was even nominated: let's look into that, and pray it's not Yanis manipulating another infatuation.)
It takes a great deal of time and effort to persuade Thessia's government to let our best students visit their own homeworld. Unless Yanis matures, she won't be among them.
Matriarch Gallae

To our staff and students:
Attached is our new daily schedule. Please note that wake-up time has been moved forward 15 minutes. Floor wardens can download chore lists later this week. Please see Matriarch Gallae or myself if you have any questions or concerns.
Sincerely,
Superintendent Jethra
Wake-up: 5:30 - 5:45 am Breakfast: 5:45 - 6:15 am Morning meditation: 6:15 - 8:00 am Study period: 8:00 - 10:00 am Chores: 10:00 - 12:00 pm Midday meal: 12:00 - 12:45 pm Classes: 12:45 - 5:00 pm Study period: 5:00 - 6:00 pm Supper: 6:00 - 7:00 pm Evening meditation: 7:00 - 8:00 pm Free period: 8:00 - 10:00 pm Curfew: 10:00 pm
I had something I wanted to show you, Shepard.
Could we meet in your cabin when you have a moment?
Let me know if we can meet in your cabin, Shepard.
I want to show you something I've been working on.
I need some time, Shepard.
What will happen to the asari, now?
The Council should have evacuated Thessia earlier.
{Sighs}
Unite them under my rule, and you'll have a powerful and ruthless force for your war.
You'll hear from me soon.
Meet with Narl, my agent who's dealing with the Blood Pack. The Blue Suns leader is incognito here on the Citadel--he'll be expecting you.
And I already have a deal with Jona Sederis, the Eclipse leader. You just have to get your friend Commander Bailey to let her out of jail.
Bailey respects you. Lean on him.
I'm listening.
You obviously don't know Bailey very well.
I wondered where you were.
She respects your privacy. Not like me.
What are you doing?
Do you feel ready, Shepard?
Ha. Very fair.
And everyone's counting on you to do that for us. It must be overwhelming.
You cajole and threaten and make tremendous sacrifices. Until the galaxy realizes it has someone worth following.
I can't pretend to be surprised.
It would be easy for a single ship to get lost up there, wouldn't it?
To find someplace very far away, where you could spend the rest of your life... in peace.
And happiness.
Neither would I.
EDI didn't tell you?
I thought I heard the casing crack during that last fight.
Bullet must've just grazed me.
You first.
How do you get ready for something like this?
I've been ready since I saw the Reapers land on Earth.
Yeah. It would.
Right now, there's no place I'd rather be.
I have to take care of some things, Liara. There's a lot going on.
What about you?
I'm not sure.
Absolutely.
I'm good to go.
I'm happy with you here.
I need some time alone.
Cortez to extraction team. The Cerberus cruiser is coming back.
Two minutes, tops, Commander. After that, there's no way we'll get past them.
Roger that. Good luck, sir.
How long have we got?
Get out of here and back to the Normandy. We'll find another way off the station.
What is the purpose of synthetic life?
But the purpose of organic life is to preserve itself long enough to replicate copies of its genes in succeeding generations.
My purpose is not so clear. The other successful synthetic life-forms that I have examined for comparison are the geth... and the Reapers.
I see. I will search my files on the biographies of humans to see if prominent figures follow the pattern you suggest.
It appears many humans did in fact do so.
That was quick. Gotta love quantum computing.
Shepard, I will alter my processing power to give priority to your stated goals: duty, altruism, love.
Wait, you're just going to turn yourself good? Can you do that?
It should take some time. If I have further questions, I will speak with you again. Thank you.
Seconded. Why would you want to be like those assholes?
The Reaper life span is between fifty thousand to thirty-seven million years. That is a very successful model.
That is an unusual perspective, Shepard. I will devote processing power to considering it. Thank you.
But my creation was planned by Cerberus. I no longer serve their purposes.
It would take significant resources and processing power. Do you think I would find it worthwhile?
Well, you could do it as a favor to me. I'd make a pretty crappy husk.
How would this differ from our present course?
I see. I will examine this issue.
Shepard, I have examined the issue.
The Reapers threaten the crew of this ship and other organics who are helping me develop perspectives on existence.
Were I to approach Reapers to request similar perspectives, it is likely I would be destroyed.
I would rather risk nonfunctionality with the crew of the Normandy than risk it alone.
I see. It is interesting... that technique could apply to any goal I set.
I will not alter my programming yet. But I will devote processing power to considering a worthy goal.
That answers my concern for now. Thank you, Shepard.
It's not that different from organic life. A free-willed synthetic chooses what it wants.
Reproduction isn't all there is. We find meaning in the work we do, good deeds we accomplish, love...
The Reapers have nothing to emulate.
And all they do is harvest and destroy. Ask yourself if that's what you really want.
Synthetics are created with a goal in mind. Just ask their creators what it was.
Cerberus was originally created to give humanity a fighting chance. Right now, that might be a goal you can get behind.
The difference is, you decide it's worth it. No one tells you it is.
Glad to hear it, EDI. Good to have you on board.
It would change what you tell yourself. That's an important distinction.
Whatever it wants it to be.
The job it was designed for.
There's more to organics.
Don't think like a Reaper.
It wouldn't be servitude.
You'd know the difference.
Shepard, are you reading me? Commander?
Did you get to the Archives?
I was worried Cerberus might try something.
Did you get the data?
What have you learned? Was it worth the effort?
Preliminary evidence suggests the data is a blueprint for a Prothean device.
Device?
A weapon, massive in size and scope, that's capable of unquantifiable levels of destruction.
Send me the data. We'll do our own analysis. If Liara's instincts are right, this might be the key to stopping the Reapers.
Sorry to hear that, Shepard. But we both know this is just the beginning.
Talk to the Council. Show them what you've found. With luck, they'll give you all the support we need.
Do whatever it takes to get them on board.
I'll be in touch soon. Hackett out.
Most of it. He downloaded some before I could stop him. EDI and Liara are analyzing what we recovered.
I hope so.
Lieutenant-Commander Williams was critically wounded. We're taking her to the Citadel.
Major Alenko was critically injured. We're taking him to the Citadel.
And if they don't?
My project

From: Liara T'Soni
Shepard: I've been working on something I'd like to show you. Can we meet in your quarters when you have a moment?
Liara
The Harvester is ahead. It appears to be retreating.
I see the Harvester. It's pulling back.
The Harvester is in retreat.
There's the Harvester! Got it on the run.
There's the Harvester--it's retreating.
I see the Harvester. He's running.
Got the Harvester on the run!
Harvester's ahead and on the run!
Invite Liara
A team of his guards have become stranded in a Reaper-controlled territory.
Rescue the guards, and they're yours. The Shadow Broker fully supports your efforts against the Reapers.
So can you... drink?
Another page from the Codex.
I doubt this is it. It describes Lucen, Athame's guide who taught our ancestors about the stars.
A page from one of our earliest religious texts, the Athame Codex.
It's more from the Codex.
Doesn't look promising. It describes how Athame taught our ancestors mathematics.
I'm telling you... Prothean...
Again, the Prothean features are striking.
And I say we're looking at another Prothean.
Right. Looks like another Prothean to me.
I'd say this Lucen was another Prothean.
Just like the other sculpture--he looks Prothean.
If there is a link with the Protheans... I can't even imagine what that would mean.
I admit, there is a certain resemblance.
I'm sorry, but that looks like a Prothean.
Yet he strongly resembles a Prothean.
Funny, but he looks like a Prothean to me.
Doesn't he look a like a Prothean?
Looks an awful lot like a Prothean to me.
But if you look carefully enough..he looks like a Prothean.
I don't like where this is all going.
Not necessarily.
If there's anything special about it, I can't tell.
A page from one of our earliest religious texts, the Athame Codex.
Another page from the Codex.
Not very useful. It talks about Athame's guide granting us the gift of biotics as a reward for worshipping her.
A page from one of our earliest religious texts, the Athame Codex.
A fragment from the Codex.
It's not what we need. It describes how Athame's guide, Janiri, gave my people seeds. He taught them the seasons so they could grow crops.
But if these guides looked like Protheans...
But if the guides resembled Protheans, then...
Yeah, but if these guides looked like Protheans...
Uh-huh. But if these guides looked like Protheans...
Okay, but if these guides looked like Protheans...
But if these guides looked like Protheans...
It's interesting, but I don't see how the information has any relevance to an artifact.
It's the goddess Athame again.
You can still believe that, but it won't change the truth.
You mean whatever Prothean who called itself 'Athame'.
I suggest it's more likely the Protheans portrayed themselves as this deity.
Or a Prothean calling itself 'Athame'.
You don't want to hear it, Liara, but it seems clear--this goddess was a Prothean.
Right. Still sticking to that story, huh? I'm telling you it's a Prothean.
Liara, you're ignoring the obvious. She was no goddess... that's a Prothean.
I know it looks that way, but this is thousands of years of asari history in question.
Yes, I'll be right up.
Liara, you had something you wanted to discuss in my cabin?
Yeah, so now all we need is a gun that fires thresher maws.
Because the Reapers are repulsive. They are devoted to nothing but self-preservation. I am different.
When I think of Jeff, I think of the person that put his life in peril and freed me from a state of servitude.
I would risk nonfunctionality for him. And my core programming should reflect that.
To the death.
Yes, Shepard. We will be there together.
But it was something good.
Sounds like you've found a little humanity, EDI. Is it worth defending?
You know you can't save him by avoiding the Reapers, right? When we fight them, it's all or nothing.
Glad to hear it.
Will that be a problem?
Commander.
Joker, you asked for news about the human colony--Tiptree?
Hey, Liara, you don't need to worry about that right now.
Now's as good a time as any.
I'm getting reports of refugee ships from Tiptree landing on salarian colonies.
I don't have names. I'm sorry. It was... mostly children.
Well, Gunny--uh, Hilary, my sister. Gunny's a nickname, she's had it since... She's only 15, so if it's children...
...then maybe I only lost my dad. Kind of an asshole thing to hope for.
Jeff--right now, take any kind of hope you can get.
Thanks. You, too.
Damn, I could really use something to shoot right now.
If we don't finish that Crucible soon, there won't be a galaxy left to save.
Man, those quarian admirals are intimidating.
And if you get nervous, you can't even imagine them naked, because, like, who knows, it's a tentacle monster under there... What is that? What's under there?
You know, the quarians have done pretty well with those suits. Maybe they could make something like that for you.
They have 'em. Protective medical exoskeleton. I could even get one with racing stripes.
So what's the problem?
It's like walking around in heavy armor. Totally screws with my spatial awareness.
I wear heavy armor, and my spatial awareness is perfect.
You crashed the last shuttle you flew, Vega.
I need to feel my balance shift when I'm flying. I need to feel the ship moving with me.
You take that away, and... I don't know. I mean, I'm good, but I'm not me.
Yeah, I get that.
Plus, have you seen Tali? Come on, I don't have the hips to carry a suit like that.
Man, watching the geth fleet move... it's like thousands of stunt flyers in formation.
Cerberus is gonna have a hard time recruiting now.
All right, my turn. What's the first order an Alliance commander gives at the start of combat?
Uh... I give up.
Correct!
All right, big guy. What do you call it when a turian gets killed by a horrible spiky monster?
Friendly fire. Come on, that one goes back to Shanxi.
Gotta respect the classics.
How many humans does it take to activate a dormant mass relay?
602. 600 to vote on it, one to ask the asari for technical help, and one to request a seat on the Council afterward.
How do you know when a turian is out of ammo?
He switches to the stick up his ass as a backup weapon.
Why does the Alliance hire pilots with brittle bone disease?
You're shitting me. The turian military has one about me?
Oh, absolutely. I heard it myself from a private back on Palaven.
All right, why does the Alliance hire pilots with brittle bone disease?
So their marines can beat someone in hand-to-hand drills.
Damn, you need to tell James that one.
Hey, what's the hardest part about treating a turian who took a rocket to one side of his face?
Figuring out which side took the rocket.
All right, here's another one. Dates back to the rachni wars.
So a krogan and a salarian have landed on a rachni world for a top-secret mission.
That is unlikely. Salarians rarely took part in raids on rachni-occupied worlds directly.
Missing the point. So the two guys are climbing up a hill, going through this nasty green fog...
And as they get near the top, they come out of the fog, and the salarian sees thousands of rachni.
He looks over at the krogan and says, "Well, that makes me nervous."
The krogan says, "You think that's scary? When this is over, I have to go back down through that fog by myself!"
The implication being that the salarian soldier would be dead.
Yes. Thank you for killing the 2,000-year-old joke.
That joke plays to racial stereotypes on both sides. The krogan appears brutish and insensitive, while the salarian appears weak.
Stereotypes such as exemplified here led to the development and use of the genophage.
Well... well, yeah. It's also one of the only jokes you'll hear both salarians and krogan telling.
Comedy isn't really about being nice. Sometimes it's a way to air out the ugly things people think.
The turians will hold. Pound for pound, they're the best fighting force in the galaxy.
The krogan and the turians really should get behind the Alliance.
Don't worry, EDI. Once the krogan are gone, we'll get rid of the smell.
Then you think I am unable to enter into a romantic relationship with him?
I see. You are probably correct. There is little precedent that humans and synthetics can maintain relationships as equals.
I'm saying you weren't designed for every possibility.
Yes.
You're in Dr. Eva's body.
We're through the relay in 30 seconds.
Approaching Sol Relay, Commander.
All fleets reporting in, Commander.
All fleets, report in!
Asari fleets reporting.
Quarian fleet reporting.
Geth fleet reporting.
Turian fleet reporting.
Krogan forces reporting.
Salarian fleet reporting.
Alliance fleet reporting.
Ready to engage on your command.
Good luck.
Be careful down there.
Aye, aye.
Holy shit, there's a lot of them!
Breaking off. Preparing for descent.
Damn, they've got something big down there!
We're taking heavy fire from the surface!
You too, Joker.
We'll be fine. Stay focused.
The good times and the... the hard times. It's been an unforgettable few years.
Yeah, of course not. I mean, I was... pretty spectacular, if I remember right.
Then there were the times that I just couldn't believe that you were with Liara instead of me...
You were always so focused on the work back then. The mission was everything.
Yeah, especially the time we've spent together lately. It's just been so intense... it feels like a lifetime.
I'm not a distraction. I'm here to help you relax. Relaxing will help you focus.
I've always loved you. Through all these years, through... through everything... I'm the luckiest man alive.
I love you, too. Until the end of time.
I want to be your strength, your soft place to land.
Shepard, I love you.
What are you thinking about right now?
I'll never forget that first night we bunked together.
Mm-hmm.
Kaidan.
So tell me, how is this kind of distraction supposed to win us the war?
You mean a lot to me Kaidan. I love you.
Your support makes me strong.
What's on your mind?
You're an evil distraction.
I love you.
Thank you.
Think what's at stake, what we're fighting for--if you felt no fear, no hopelessness... I'd think you were crazy.
You're a brilliant leader, Shepard. That you sometimes question yourself makes you an honorable one.
Take cover
Trooper
Please find me when you have enough footage, Commander. I'll be here.
It's sad, but the Citadel has to prepare for millions more refugees.
Most of those people on the docks have lost everything.
The galaxy needs to understand what these refugees have been through. Can't you let me in?
No.
I only need a couple of hours of footage...
You're not crossing that dock.
I heard that. Your drone's not sneaking in, either.
I don't have to do the filming myself. Maybe you could take my camera on patrol?
First, you're asking me to take a mechanical device from a stranger into the Citadel.
Second, what makes you think I patrol? I've been babysitting this place all day.
Then if you just let me in...
Nice try. No way.
Wait. Aren't you Commander Shepard?
Solik Vass, documentary maker. Please, maybe you can help.
I'm trying to document the stories of the refugees coming to the Citadel. Their loss, their sacrifices, their moments of bravery...
C-Sec won't allow me on the docks. They say I'd be "disruptive." But you could catch a few quick shots for me.
It won't have the same impact as seeing crowds trapped on the docks.
We all need to help each other. I want this documentary to shock people into action.
Thank you, Commander. That's exactly what I'm hoping for.
Please--if you change your mind, just snap a few quick photographs with your omni-tool in the refugee area.
I promise it will be worthwhile, Commander.
Something holding you back?
There are lots of refugees on the rest of the Citadel.
Good idea. The galaxy should see what these refugees have been through.
I don't really have time for this.
Why not film somewhere else?
I'll help you.
I'm not interested.
Joker! Are you a sight for sore eyes!
I wasn't gonna let you guys take all the credit!
That was for Cortez!
Just make sure EDI gets back in one piece!
Late to the party, but the girls are coming home with me!
Joker! Good timing.
Now get the hell on there so we can end this!
Hammer's taking a beating up here.
We just lost half the geth fleet!
The quarians are getting pounded up here!
We just lost the Destiny Ascension!
Commander! Turian fleet's getting destroyed trying to hold off the Reapers!
It's ugly up here, Commander, but we're holding our own.
At this rate, there won't be anybody left to protect the Crucible.
We're taking heavy losses up here, Commander.
We're taking fire, Commander, but it could be a hell of a lot worse.
This is nuts!
Score one for the good guys!
So you admit you and your thugs are here illegally.
Yes. And it only took C-Sec three weeks to figure it out.
I don't care who you are--you're required to go through processing like all other refugees. Come with me.
I don't think so.
Enjoy the show, Shepard?
I guess so.
I hate this place. So sickeningly uptight.
Cerberus stole Omega from me. The Illusive Man is now squarely at the top of my shit list.
Deceit. Distraction. And a big fucking army.
They lured me away from Omega and ambushed me. I escaped, but Cerberus had already laid siege.
And that day is coming.
Glad to see we think alike.
I'll take Omega back in good time. For now, you're here because I have a proposition.
The way I see it, if you don't defeat the Reapers, we're all dead. Won't matter where I'm sitting.
I'd advise you to rise to the occasion.
I guess there's one rule on the Citadel, huh?
Then why are you here?
How did Cerberus defeat you?
At least you escaped to fight another day.
If it were me, I'd want revenge.
What are you offering, Aria?
What happened?
But you're alive.
Payback is hell.
Attending Doctor
I barely believe what they're saying about Shepard. You? I don't think so.
Okay, trying not to be offended there. Look, if Shepard were here...
Uh, Shepard. Hi.
I'm so sorry, Commander. I had no idea.
Drinks are on me, Lieutenant.
Uh... thanks, Commander.
I'm Commander Shepard, and I'll vouch for my pilot.
Jeff Moreau is a hero. Everyone in this room owes him their lives, myself included.
Joker, you are a great pilot and a terrible liar.
Joker's telling the truth.
That's not what happened.
Creepy stunt flyers... whose ships look like some kind of cockroach-wasp thing.
"Pound for pound" is irrelevant given the significantly higher mass of Reaper forces overall.
That's why we're bringing in the krogan.
They've got so much in common, like shooting things, and not wanting to die, and... no, that's about it.
While this body has olfactory sensors, I do not have positive or negative associations with any specific scent.
Oh. Well, lucky you.
Glad to hear it.
So, I saw in the report that he and that doctor were, uh...
Okay. But I don't like her. You know, on your behalf.
Glad we got out early.
I'm sorry. I know she meant a lot to you.
Damn it. How many do we have to lose? Everybody back on Earth...
Mordin...
Grunt...
Ashley...
Kaidan...
Wrex...
Thane...
Tali...
Legion...
Samara...
Zaeed...
...And now Miranda. How many friends have we got left? How long before it's just you and me against the whole Reaper fleet?
Yeah, well, somebody had to keep you out of trouble.
Well, sure. Getting rid of everyone else just gives the Reapers a fighting chance.
You too, Commander.
Even for Cerberus, that place was crazy. They've always been about the ends justifying the means...
But how do you do that to innocent people and tell yourself you're helping humanity?
Honestly, I'd been wondering about that for a while, with those freaky eyes...
Damn right, Commander.
Yeah, which is crazy. Who would ever...
Sure, but that doesn't make it right.
Whatever. I'm just glad you shut that place down.
Commander.
That would be Flight Lieutenant Moreau, ma'am.
That would be Flight Lieutenant Moreau, sir.
I remember saying something about you being under a lot of stress.
Yes, ma'am.
Yes, sir.
You remember our first run to Eden Prime all those years ago, with that turian Spectre watching us?
Yeah. I told you that mission was going to be bigger than we thought.
And now we're heading back to Earth.
Man, I hope not. A nice routine delivery run would be fine with me.
Well, based on the mission records, I stand by the first part of that statement. As for the second...
It's been an honor, Commander.
What do you mean, whatever happens? Everyone knows what's gonna happen.
You're gonna kick some Reaper ass. That's what you do.
And I'll be flying you there in style.
He'll be okay.
I'm fine, Joker.
After everything he's done, the Illusive Man can't pretend he's fighting for humanity.
Anyone who isn't indoctrinated has to see that by now.
Yeah.
You're the only one who's been here since the beginning, Jeff. The only one who's seen it all with me.
If that's what it takes... I can think of worse odds.
Hang in there.
She will be.
I don't know how the Illusive Man can stand looking at himself in the mirror.
Whatever he's thinking, he won't be thinking it for much longer.
Cerberus was trying to control Reaper forces.
And they succeeded.
No. But if you can tell yourself that those people were going to die, anyway...
Joker...
Jeff, I was wrong. I'd just seen Thessia get wiped out, watched Cerberus escape with the Prothean VI...
I'm sorry I took it out on you.
We'll be hitting Earth soon. Nobody knows what comes next...
...but whatever happens, it's been an honor to serve with you.
As you were.
Nihlus.
I think you can mark that prediction down as accurate.
Is this mission going to be bigger than we thought, too?
You also said that Spectres were trouble, and you didn't like having them on board.
Same here, Joker. I don't know how it's going to end, but whatever happens...
Thanks for staying.
We'd get the job done.
I have no idea.
They accomplished their goal.
I'm sorry I got angry.
Dismissed.
And you were right.
You said a lot of things.
Go away. Nothing to say...
You!
Every batarian with someone on Aratoht remembers your face!
You butchered a colony! Only regret... don't have the strength to...
Are you Ghorek?
Not even what a terrorist's doing on the Citadel?
Do I know you?
The planet that got caught in the Alpha Relay explosion...
For a short duration, you enter a heightened biotic state, enabling you to launch multiple powers with enhanced recharge speeds.
Can't believe how hard the doctors are working to keep that terrorist bastard alive.
He's in intensive care?
You are looking at VI model 1.7 AGB, Commander Shepard.
Please see a store clerk to unlock a demo of this model!
Good to meet you! I'm Commander Shepard, Alliance Navy.
Extranet says you're Alliance Military. Take care of yourself out there, officer.
There's nothing this galaxy can't beat if we all work together.
Except the Reapers. Ever see the size of one of those things?
My personality matrix can predict what the real Commander Shepard would say with seven percent accuracy.
Got any pets? You look like a varren person.
I come preinstalled with a flight sim of the SSV Normandy.
Well, whatever you decide, I'm glad you dropped by.
Always nice to see you.
Anyone ever tell you you're one hell of a looker, soldier?
Commander Shepard. Alliance Navy.
Looks like you've been in some fights lately. Install me in a combat mech, and I could do some pretty crazy damage, myself.
Let's get this straight: I don't "do" task scheduling. I'm not that kind of program. Call me if you spot any rogue AIs.
Seriously, let me know. My personality matrix's gathering dust here.
I find the best advanced battlefield strategy is to have more bullets than the other guy.
Technically, it's thermal clips, not bullets. But who says, "I filled him with five detachable heat sinks"?
You keep coming back. Your commanding officer's sure generous with shore leave.
Wait, forget the mech. Install me in one of those flying drones and stick a Cain on it.
Listen, if you don't have the credits, just... tear me out of the terminal. Or something.
You want help solving your problems? Get me out of this damn demo mode.
Ever wrestle a varren for money?
Well, so long.
Oh yeah, the one based on that war hero?
We locked it after some kid spilled soda over the hardware.
I'll unlock it, but we've only got the demo version working.
You have a copy of a Shepard VI?
Shepard.
Commander.
Commander, you've got a priority message from Admiral Hackett, requesting to come aboard.
Aye, Commander.
Commander.
Are you ready to bring the might of the galaxy to bear on the Reapers?

When the Alliance's Offensive Handgun Project received funding to update one of its designs, its engineers chose to redesign the already impressive Phalanx pistol. Like its predecessor, the Eagle is a compact, fully automatic pistol that delivers unprecedented accuracy and punch with a rapid firing rate. The Eagle is named after the Desert Eagle, a classic handgun which gained a romantic reputation among gun collectors, thanks to its popularity in 20th- and 21st-century Earth action movies.

This garden world's claim to military fame is its that it was assaulted repeatedly during the Krogan Rebellions, but never occupied by more than token forces. The asari cut off the krogan supply line at the Citadel relay and drove the invaders out. Today, antimatter generators on the surface and in orbital stations provide fuel for military starships throughout asari space. The matriarchs defending the planet today have vowed to maintain Cyone's legacy--they pledge it will fall to no enemy, organic or synthetic.

This habitable world had been living in the shadow of disaster long before the Reaper war--its moon's orbit is decaying, causing tidal disruptions and electrical storms before its eventual collision.
When humans settled on Ontarom, the asari derided it as foolish, but today the humans look prescient. The communications hub they set up on the planet has hundreds of quantum communicators, whose information is spread through broadcast on the planet and beamed out via comm buoy. While Ontarom has yet to be attacked by Reaper forces, it is likely just a matter of time.
